member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AggregationViewer.Viewers.Advanced_Search_MimeType_AggregationViewer
member.summary: Renders the advanced search page for a given item aggregation
member.remarks:
This class implements the interface and extends the class.
Aggregation viewers are used when displaying aggregation home pages, searches, browses, and information pages.
During a valid html request to display the advanced search page, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in this case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. For a collection-level request, an instance of the class is created.
To display the requested collection view, the collection subwriter will creates an instance of this class

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AggregationViewer.Viewers.abstractAggregationViewer
member.summary: Abstract class which all collection viewer classes extend
member.remarks:
This class implements the interface.
Collection viewers are used when displaying collection home pages, searches, browses, and information pages.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. For a collection-level request, an instance of the class is created.
To display the requested collection view, the collection subwriter will create one or more collection viewers ( implementing this class )

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AggregationViewer.Viewers.Rotating_Highlight_MimeType_AggregationViewer
member.summary: Renders the basic search / home page for a given item aggregation
member.remarks:
This class implements the interface and extends the class.
Collection viewers are used when displaying collection home pages, searches, browses, and information pages.
During a valid html request to display the home page with basic search, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in this case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. For a collection-level request, an instance of the class is created.
To display the requested collection view, the collection subwriter will creates an instance of this class

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.HTML.Admin_HtmlSubwriter
member.summary: Adminl subwriter is used for administrative tasks, either collection admin, portal admin, or system admin
member.remarks:
This class extends the abstract class.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create this necessary subwriter since this action requires administrative rights.
This class will create a admin subwriter (extending ) for the specified task.The admin subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to view and edit existing item aggregationPermissions in this digital library

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.ItemViewer.Viewers.Aware_JP2_ItemViewer
member.summary: Item viewer displays a JPEG2000 file related to the digital resource, allowing zoom and pan.
member.remarks:
This class extends the abstract class and implements the interface.
This class was written specifically for the Aware JPEG2000 server, and will need modifications to work with any other JPEG2000 server software.

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AdminViewer.Aggregation_Single_AdminViewer
member.summary: Class allows an authenticated aggregation admin to edit information related to a single item aggregation.
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to view and edit information related to a single item aggregation

'"The information in this section controls how search results or item browses appears. The facet options control which metadata values appear to the left of the results, to allow users to narrow their results. The search results values determine which options are available for viewing the results and what are the aggregation defaults. Finally, the result fields determines which values are displayed with each individual result in the result set."' localization string

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.MySobekViewer.abstract_MySobekViewer
member.summary: Abstract class which all mySobek viewer classes extend
member.remarks:
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. If the action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
To allow the requested action, the mySobek subwriter will create one of the mySobek viewers( implementing this class )

member.name: F:SobekCM.Library.MySobekViewer.abstract_MySobekViewer.emptybehaviors
member.summary: Empty list of behaviors, returned by default
member.remarks: This just prevents an empty set from having to be created over and over

member.summary: Class holds all the individual setting values for the uploaders

member.summary: Constructor for a new instance of the UploadiFive_Settings class

member.summary: Add the file input and the necessary script section, with all the options specfiedi here, directly to the streamwriter
member.param: Writer to write to the stream
Extra indent to begin each line with (purely for formatting)
Message to display on fallback, particularly when HTML5 and flash both fail

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Version
member.summary: Version being utilized, either the HTML5 version (UploadiFive) or the FLASH version (Uploadify)
member.value: Default is to use the HTML5 version

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FileInputID
member.summary: ID to use for the file input element
member.value: Default value is 'file_upload'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FileInputClass
member.summary: Class to use for the file input element
member.value: Default value is 'file_upload'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.UseSecureFileHandler
member.summary: Flag indicates if the secure file handler option should be used
member.remarks: This sets a value in the session state and then checks it upon upload

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.SubmitWhenQueueCompletes
member.summary: Flag indicates if the form should be submitted once the uploaded queue completes

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.UploadPath
member.summary: Path where the uploaded files should go

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.AllowedFileExtensions
member.summary: List of file extensions allowed

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.DisallowedFileExtenstionMessage
member.summary: If a user attempts to upload a disallowed file extension, this is the message that will be popped up to the user
member.remarks: You can use '<extension>' in the string to have the extension of the attempted file in your message. Setting this to an empty string will cause no alert to happen clientside, but the upload will be cancelled.
member.value: Default value is 'File types of '<extension>' are not allowed'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.RevertToFlashVersion
member.summary: Flag indicates that if the client does not have HTML5 with their browser, to revert to the Flash version, if it is available
member.value: Default value is FALSE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.RevertedButtonClass
member.summary: If this is set, this class will be used for the button when the HTML5 version has reverted to the flash version.
member.value: Can be useful to see if it reverts

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.NoHtml5OrFlashMessage
member.summary: Message displayed if the user has neither HTML5 on their browse nor Flash installed
member.value: Default value is 'Your browse must either be HTML5-compliant or have Adobe Flash installed to use this upload feature'.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ServerSideFileName
member.summary: Name for the final server-side file, which allows overriding the default name, which would otherwise match the uploaded name
member.remarks: This can be used to avoid having to manually rename the file after upload

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Auto
member.summary: If set to true, files will automatically upload when added to the queue
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ButtonClass
member.summary: A class name to add to the UploadiFive button DOM element

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ButtonText
member.summary: The text to display inside the browse button
member.remarks: This text is rendered as HTML and may contain tags or HTML entities.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.CheckScript
member.summary: The path to the server-side files that checks whether a files with the same name as that being uploaded exists in the destination folder
member.remarks: If the file does not exist, this script should return 0. If the files does exist, the script should return 1.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.DragAndDrop
member.summary: If set to false, drag and drop capabilities will not be enabled
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FileObjName
member.summary: The name of the file object to use in your server-side script
member.remarks: For example, in PHP, if this option is set to the_files, you can access the files that have been uploaded using $_FILES['the_files'];
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'Filedata'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FileSizeLimit
member.summary: The maximum upload size allowed in KB
member.remarks: This option also accepts a unit. If using a unit, the value must begin with a number and end in either KB, MB, or GB. Set this option to 0 for no limit.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FileType
member.summary: The type of files allowed for upload
member.remarks: This is taken from the files mime type. To allow all images, set this option to image. To allow a specific type of image, set this option to image/png. To allow all files, set this value to false. This option will also accept a JSON array to allow a specific set of fileTypes.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'false'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.FormData
member.summary: Additional data to send to the server-side upload script
member.remarks: Data sent via this option will be sent via the headers and can be accessed via the $_POST array (if using the post method). So if you send something like {someKey : someValue}, then you can access it as $_POST['someKey'].

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ButtonHeight
member.summary: The height of the browse button in pixels
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 30

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ItemTemplate
member.summary: The itemTemplate option allows you to specify a special HTML template for each item that is added to the queue
member.value: The outtermost item element MUST have the class uploadifive-queue-item as the code uses this class to perform various tasks. See instructions on main Uploadify site for more information.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Method
member.summary: The type of method to use when submitting the form
member.remarks: If set to get, the formData values are sent via the querystring. If set to post, the fromData values are sent via the headers.
member.value: Default value is POST

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Multi
member.summary: Whether or not to allow multiple file selection in the browse dialog window
member.remarks: Setting to true will allow multiple file selection. This does not affect the amount of files that can be added tot he queue. To limit the queue size to 1, use the QueueSizeLimit option.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.QueueID
member.summary: The ID of the element you want to use as a file queue
member.remarks: This element will also act as the drop target for files if DragAndDrop (dnd) is set to true. If the value is set to false, a queue will be created and an ID will be assigned to it.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'false;

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.QueueSizeLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of files you can have in the queue at one time
member.remarks: This does not affect the amount of files that may be uploaded. To set the amount of files you may upload, use the uploadLimit option. Set to 0 to set the limit to unlimited.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.RemoveCompleted
member.summary: Whether or not to remove items that have completed uploading from the queue
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is FALSE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.Swf
member.summary: This is the location of the uploadify.swf file, including the name of the script
member.remarks: Default, if using flash, is 'uploadify/uploadify.swf'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.SimUploadLimit
member.summary: The number of files that can be simultaneously uploaded at any given time
member.remarks: Set to 0 to remove the limit.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.TruncateLength
member.summary: The number of characters at which to truncate the file name in the queue
member.remarks: Set to 0 to never truncate.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.UploadLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of files that may be uploaded
member.remarks: Set to 0 to remove any limit. This does not affect the number of files that may be added to the queue. For that, use the QueueSizeLimit option.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.UploadScript
member.summary: The path to the script that will process the uploaded file
member.remarks: To use the provided ASP.net classes/helpers, do NOT set this directly. For the FLASH version, this actually maps to the 'uploader' value.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive_Settings.ButtonWidth
member.summary: The width of the browse button in pixels
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 100

member.summary: List of file extensions allowed

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.DisallowedFileExtenstionMessage
member.summary: If a user attempts to upload a disallowed file extension, this is the message that will be popped up to the user
member.remarks: You can use '<extension>' in the string to have the extension of the attempted file in your message. Setting this to an empty string will cause no alert to happen clientside, but the upload will be cancelled.
member.value: Default value is 'File types of '<extension>' are not allowed'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.RevertToFlashVersion
member.summary: Flag indicates that if the client does not have HTML5 with their browser, to revert to the Flash version, if it is available

member.summary: If this is set, this class will be used for the button when the HTML5 version has reverted to the flash version.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.NoHtml5OrFlashMessage
member.summary: Message displayed if the user has neither HTML5 on their browse nor Flash installed
member.value: Default value is 'Your browse must either be HTML5-compliant or have Adobe Flash installed to use this upload feature'.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.ServerSideFileName
member.summary: Name for the final server-side file, which allows overriding the default name, which would otherwise match the uploaded name
member.remarks: This can be used to avoid having to manually rename the file after upload

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.Auto
member.summary: If set to true, files will automatically upload when added to the queue
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.ButtonClass
member.summary: A class name to add to the UploadiFive button DOM element

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.ButtonText
member.summary: The text to display inside the browse button
member.remarks: This text is rendered as HTML and may contain tags or HTML entities.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.CheckScript
member.summary: The path to the server-side files that checks whether a files with the same name as that being uploaded exists in the destination folder
member.remarks: If the file does not exist, this script should return 0. If the files does exist, the script should return 1.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.DragAndDrop
member.summary: If set to false, drag and drop capabilities will not be enabled
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.FileObjName
member.summary: The name of the file object to use in your server-side script
member.remarks: For example, in PHP, if this option is set to the_files, you can access the files that have been uploaded using $_FILES['the_files'];
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'Filedata'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.FileSizeLimit
member.summary: The maximum upload size allowed in KB
member.remarks: This option also accepts a unit. If using a unit, the value must begin with a number and end in either KB, MB, or GB. Set this option to 0 for no limit.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.FileType
member.summary: The type of files allowed for upload
member.remarks: This is taken from the files mime type. To allow all images, set this option to image. To allow a specific type of image, set this option to image/png. To allow all files, set this value to false. This option will also accept a JSON array to allow a specific set of fileTypes.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'false'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.FormData
member.summary: Additional data to send to the server-side upload script
member.remarks: Data sent via this option will be sent via the headers and can be accessed via the $_POST array (if using the post method). So if you send something like {someKey : someValue}, then you can access it as $_POST['someKey'].

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.ButtonHeight
member.summary: The height of the browse button in pixels
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 30

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.ItemTemplate
member.summary: The itemTemplate option allows you to specify a special HTML template for each item that is added to the queue
member.value: The outtermost item element MUST have the class uploadifive-queue-item as the code uses this class to perform various tasks. See instructions on main Uploadify site for more information.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.Method
member.summary: The type of method to use when submitting the form
member.remarks: If set to get, the formData values are sent via the querystring. If set to post, the fromData values are sent via the headers.
member.value: Default value is POST

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.Multi
member.summary: Whether or not to allow multiple file selection in the browse dialog window
member.remarks: Setting to true will allow multiple file selection. This does not affect the amount of files that can be added tot he queue. To limit the queue size to 1, use the QueueSizeLimit option.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is TRUE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.QueueID
member.summary: The ID of the element you want to use as a file queue
member.remarks: This element will also act as the drop target for files if DragAndDrop (dnd) is set to true. If the value is set to false, a queue will be created and an ID will be assigned to it.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 'false;

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.QueueSizeLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of files you can have in the queue at one time
member.remarks: This does not affect the amount of files that may be uploaded. To set the amount of files you may upload, use the uploadLimit option. Set to 0 to set the limit to unlimited.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.RemoveCompleted
member.summary: Whether or not to remove items that have completed uploading from the queue
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is FALSE

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.SimUploadLimit
member.summary: The number of files that can be simultaneously uploaded at any given time
member.remarks: Set to 0 to remove the limit.

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.Swf
member.summary: This is the location of the uploadify.swf file, including the name of the script
member.remarks: Default, if using flash, is 'uploadify/uploadify.swf'

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.TruncateLength
member.summary: The number of characters at which to truncate the file name in the queue
member.remarks: Set to 0 to never truncate.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.name: P:SobekCM.Library.UploadiFive.UploadiFive.UploadLimit
member.summary: The maximum number of files that may be uploaded
member.remarks: Set to 0 to remove any limit. This does not affect the number of files that may be added to the queue. For that, use the QueueSizeLimit option.
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 0

member.summary: The path to the script that will process the uploaded file
member.remarks: To use the provided ASP.net classes/helpers, do NOT set this directly

member.summary: The width of the browse button in pixels
member.value: Default value from UploadiFive is 100

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AggregationViewer.Viewers.Item_Count_AggregationViewer
member.summary: Renders the item count information for a single aggregation

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AdminViewer.Settings_AdminViewer
member.summary: Class allows an authenticated system admin to view and edit the library-wide system settings in this library
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to show the library-wide system settings in this digital library

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AdminViewer.Home_AdminViewer
member.summary: Class allows a system admin to view the administrative home page, with all their options in a menu
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to display the system admin home page

member.param: All the necessary, non-global data specific to the current request

member.summary: Add the HTML to be displayed in the main SobekCM viewer area
member.param: Textwriter to write the HTML for this viewer
Trace object keeps a list of each method executed and important milestones in rendering

member.summary: Title for the page that displays this viewer, this is shown in the search box at the top of the page, just below the banner
member.value: The value of this message changes, depending on if this is the RequestSpecificValues.Current_User's first time here. It is always a welcoming message though

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.AggregationViewer.Viewers.DataSet_Browse_Info_AggregationViewer
member.summary: Renders the item list matching a browse or search against an item aggregation
member.remarks:
This class implements the interface and extends the class.
Aggregation viewers are used when displaying aggregation home pages, searches, browses, and information pages.
During a valid html request to display items matching a browse or search, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in this case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. For a collection-level request, an instance of the class is created.
To display the requested collection view, the collection subwriter will creates an instance of this class
To display the actual results, this class will create an instance of the class
That subwriter creates its own results viewer which extends the class

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.HTML.MySobek_HtmlSubwriter
member.summary: My Sobek html subwriter is used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks
member.remarks:
This class extends the abstract class.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create this necessary subwriter since this action requires authentication.
This class will create a mySobek subwriter (extending ) for the specified task.The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to view and edit existing item aggregationPermissions in this digital library

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.MySobekViewer.Edit_Item_Metadata_MySobekViewer
member.summary: Class allows an authenticated RequestSpecificValues.Current_User to edit a digital resource online, using various possible templates
member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer to display the item for editing
This viewer uses the class to display the correct elements for editing

member.remarks:
This class extends the class.
MySobek Viewers are used for registration and authentication with mySobek, as well as performing any task which requires authentication, such as online submittal, metadata editing, and system administrative tasks.
During a valid html request, the following steps occur:
Application state is built/verified by the
Request is analyzed by the and output as a
Main writer is created for rendering the output, in his case the
The HTML writer will create the necessary subwriter. Since this action requires authentication, an instance of the class is created.
The mySobek subwriter creates an instance of this viewer for submitting a new digital resource
This viewer uses the class to display the correct elements for editing

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.Email.URL_Email_Helper.Send_Email(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates and sends the email when a user 'shares' a single digital resource
member.param: Recepient list for this email
CC list for this email
Sender's comments to be included in the email
Name of the user that sent this email
Name of the current SobekCM instance (i.e., UDC, dLOC, etc..)
URL being shared
Title associated with the URL
Tells if this should be sent as HMTL, otherwise it will be plain text
Short term which explains the type of URL being emailed (i.e., 'browse', 'search', etc..)
member.returns: Any caught error message

member.name: T:SobekCM.Library.Email.Usage_Stats_Email_Helper
member.summary: Static helper class assists with sending usage statistics emails for the monthly emails regarding individual usage on items which are linked to users

member.name: M:SobekCM.Library.Email.Usage_Stats_Email_Helper.Send_Individual_Usage_Email(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sends one email to a user from the system including individual usage on items which are linked to the user
member.param: Primary key for whom to send the email
Name of the user to include in the email
Email address to use for this email
Year of statistics to highlight in the email
Month of statistics to highlight in the email
Number of items to include in this email, in case the user has many, many items linked
Base URL to use for links to these items
member.returns: TRUE if succesful, otherwise FALSE
